key_facts: Global coffee prices have reached record highs.
Arabica beans are priced over $3.44 per pound.
Poor weather in Brazil and Vietnam is driving price increases.
Brazil and Vietnam experienced droughts followed by heavy rains.
Weather conditions are threatening the 2025 coffee crop.
Supply of both Arabica and Robusta beans is reduced.
Nestlé and Lavazza may pass higher costs to consumers.
Major coffee companies had previously absorbed price increases.
Coffee consumption in China has more than doubled in a decade.
Low inventories and strong demand are keeping prices high.
Coffee is the second most traded commodity after oil.
Experts expect continued market pressure on coffee prices.
